title: E6B Conversions
notes: Use an E6B for all computations below. Answers may be less accurate than with a calculator, and may include a small amount of variation depending on how you read the E6B.

questions.question: Convert 35nm to SM and KM (using an E6B).
Convert 97km to NM and SM.
What is 1 metre in feet? (Rounded to 1dp).
Convert 12.7 metres to feet.
Convert 154 feet to metres.
_____ is the internationally accepted unit for weight, although _____ is still commonly used.
Convert 431kg to pounds.
Convert 82lb to kg.
1 Imperial Gallon = _____ litre = _____ US gal.
1 US gal = _____ litre = _____ Imp. gal.
For approximations, 1 US or Imperial gallon is roughly _____ litres, and US gallons and Imperial gallons are __________.
Convert 15 US gal to Imperial gal and litres.
The weight of a fluid (eg. aviation fuel) is determined by its SG, which stands for __________. What is the calculation for SG?
questions.answer: Specific Gravity. SG = weight of a particular fluid / weight of the same volume of water.

questions.question: Fluids lighter than water have an SG of __________. Fluids heaver than water have an SG of __________.
SG (is/is not) constant. Explain why.
questions.answer: Is not. Can be affected by temperature and component mix.
